post.summary: CleanupReviews kicks off a workflow to cleanup reviews for a listing
Get the details of the latest record of a source being re-scraped.
Scrape all listings for a particular source, optionally on a per-partner basis.

ListProxyAddresses returns the proxy addresses for the different proxy groups
This allows Web-Crawler to be the source of truth for the proxy addresses
If other services need to use the proxy addresses, they can call this endpoint to get the latest proxy addresses

ChildRuleIndexToTake.title: Whether we want to use the json array index or take all values within a JSON array

startDate.description: Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD, eg. 2020-01-25. Must be before end_date.

endDate.description: Date in the format YYYY-MM-DD, eg. 2020-01-25. Must be after start_date.

ToTakeNodePosition.title: What nodes to select relative to the identified one

ToTakeTake.title: What nodes we want to take

v1Action.title: A collector can be run with multiple intents specified by the action

v1Callbacks.title:
Callbacks that will be fired on the collector
The available callbacks that can be registered on a collector: http://go-colly.org/docs/introduction/start/

jsonArrayIndex.title: The element number within a json list that you want to scrape when running the PARSE_JSON callback

countStarsConfig.description: Config for counting stars that appear as individual elements on the page, rather than having a number.

rules.title: A child rule can also have its own rules where again we are scraping nested content

v1ChildRule.title: Used to parse nested content from an html fragment

listingId.title:
Provide either listing_id or listing_key to identify the listing (one is required)
listing ID of the listing to cleanup reviews for

listingKey.title: listing key of the listing to cleanup reviews for

commit.title: whether or not to mark the reviews as deleted, default is false

force.title: optional param that allows the workflow to be run multiple times

deleteNoExternalId.title: optional param that when true will cause reviews without an external ID to be deleted

callbacks.title: the callbacks that will be applied to the collector when running

startUrl.title: optional start url for the collector to start with

sourceId.title: the source id the collector is for

urlValidationRegex.title: regex that validates this is a valid listing url

headers.title: Headers to use to fetch the sitemaps

disallowedUrlFilters.title: regex restricts visiting urls that matches it (opposite behavior of url_validation_regex)

collectorType.title: collector_type is the type of collector this is

status.title: status is the current run status of the collector

v1Collector.title: Collector is the representation of a gocolly collector

itemToCount.description: item_to_count is a selector to identify the repeated thing that needs to be counted.

maximumExpectedItems.description: maximum_expected_items is the largest possible umber of things, eg 5/5 stars could have 5 star images to count.

maximumStarValue.description:
maximum_star_value is used to normalize the number of counted things down to a star value.
eg. there are a max of 10 images, each of 1/2 stars, with a maximum star value of 5, it will normalise 7/10 to 3.5/5.

v1CountStarsConfig.description:
CountStarsConfig contains configuration necessary to run the CALLBACK_COUNT_STARS callback.
The selector on the rule should select the element that contains the elements that need to be counted.

id.title: the id of the newly created collector

scraperType.title: type of scraper that caused the incident

id.title: the id of the lockdown to delete

sourceId.description: The source for which you want to know the scraping status.

v1GetMultiMostRecentLockdownRequest.title:
GetMultiMostRecentLockdownRequest returns the most recent
(not deleted) lockdown for each of the provided sources

scraperType.title: type of scraper that caused the incident

created.title: Timestamp when the incident was created

workflowId.title: ID of Temporal Workflow during which the incident was created

content.title: Content scraped when the incident was created

v1Incident.title: Incident is the representation of an error that occurred while scraping a webpage

filters.title: Filters to apply when listing collectors

pagingOptions.title: Options for how to page the response for this request

filters.title: Filters to apply when listing incidents

pagingOptions.title: Options for how to page the response for this request

filters.title: Filters to apply when listing lockdowns

pagingOptions.title: Options for how to page the response for this request

filters.title: Filters to apply when listing scrapers

pagingOptions.title: Options for how to page the response for this request

potentialRemovalIndicator.description: potential_removal_indicator is a string that can be used to determine if a listing has been removed from the source website.

v1Listing.title: Listing represents a unique scraped listing in Web Crawler

scraperType.title: type of scraper that caused the incident

userId.title: the user that created the lockdown

message.title: the error message or reason that resulted in the lockdown

created.title: Timestamp when the lockdown was created

updated.title: Timestamp when the lockdown was updated

deleted.title: Timestamp when the lockdown was deleted

v1OnHTML.description: OnHTML callback is handled just after onResponse. Used for custom handling of html selectors.

v1OnResponse.title: OnResponse callback is the first callback to fire. Used for custom handling of scrape events

v1OnScraped.title:
OnScraped callback is the last callback to fire. The Storage handler allows the raw response to be uploaded to
a cloud storage bucket

v1OnXML.title: OnXMl callback would typically be used for handling a sitemap

disableCompression.description: disable_compression is used to set the DisableCompression on the http.Transport object for when a collector makes requests to get site maps.

concurrentRequestLimit.title: ConcurrentRequestLimit limits the requests per second that can be made to a source

disableImages.title: When true the chrome proxy will skip image resources

allowCors.title: When true proxy will allow CORS requests

windowDataSelector.title: window_data_selector lets us grab data (usually JSON) from the window object instead of return HTML this will return the data you select

sitemapUsePuppeteer.title: sitemap_use_puppeteer tells the colly collector to use a puppeteer transport when we are running with a COLLECT action

disableAdblock.title: Disable Adblock when creating puppeteer browser

waitForSelector.title: Wait for a selector to render before downloading a webpage

waitSecondsAfterLoad.title: The number of seconds to wait after the webpage is loaded so that more information could be loaded and saved

selectorToClick.title: The selector of button or field that will be clicked on the webpage to load more information

navigationTimeout.title: The number of seconds to wait for the webpage to timeout

openShadowDom.title: Allows scraping from closed shadow DOM

waitSecondsAfterClick.title: The number of seconds to wait after clicking selector

waitSecondsAfterBeingBlocked.title: The number of seconds to wait after being blocked

v1Options.title: Options to be used when registering a new collector

cursor.title: cursor can be passed to retrieve the next page of results keyed by the cursor

pageSize.title: page_size specifies the number of items to return in the next page

nextCursor.title: A cursor that can be provided to retrieve the next page of results

hasMore.title: Whether or not more results exist

groupIndex.title: Only set group index when pattern match type is group

v1Review.title: Review represents a unique scraped review in Web Crawler

v1ReviewComment.title: ReviewComment represents a unique scraped review comment in Web Crawler

jsonArrayIndex.title: The element number within a json list that you want to scrape when running the PARSE_JSON callback

schemaSelector.title: The element key and value within a json listing that you want to scrape when running the PARSE_JSON callback

countStarsConfig.description: Config for counting stars that appear as individual elements on the page, rather than having a number.

v1Rule.title: Rule used to parse content from a document fragment

key.title: Essentially the "key" of a json document. For structured data this typically corresponds with @type

value.title: The string value of the key field that we are looking for, eg. @type: "Hotel"

v1SchemaSelector.title: SchemaSelector is used to select data from a JSON document

force.title:
Ignore idempotency key to rescrape listing immediately.
This is only intended for use during debugging by developers or one-time operations via superadmin.
It should not be used by other services as it is an expensive operation

sourceId.description: The source for which we want to re-scrape all listings.

timeFrame.title: A time frame that indicates that we want to scrape listings that were last scraped after start_time and before end_time

partnerIds.description: The list of partner ids whose accounts we want to scrape listings for the source.

accountGroupIds.description: A list of account groups to re-scrape listings for. If account_group_ids is specified, partner_ids is ignored.

forceRefetch.description: Specifying force re-fetch will make all scraped listings fetch from the site, rather than scraping the html we have saved.

workflowId.description: The ID of the cadence workflow that was started.

rescrape.title: optional param that when true all reviews found (determined by the starting page) will be rescraped

updateReviews.title: optional param that when true the workflow will update duplicate reviews with scraped content

updateFields.title: optional param that specify which fields could be updated when update_reviews is true

force.title:
optional param that when true the review scraping will be started no matter if review scraping has been done recently
This is only intended for use during debugging by developers or one-time operations via superadmin.
It should not be used by other services as it is an expensive operation

continueForExpiredAccount.title: optional param that when true will cause a re-scrape even when RM has expired

status.description: The current status of the scraper.

reviewResetTime.description: When specified, all reviews for listings last scraped before this date will be deleted and re-scraped from scratch.

v1Scraper.title: Scraper contains the rules to apply to an html fragment to extract information

v1ScraperStatus.title:
- SCRAPER_STATUS_ACTIVE: Status when a scraper is ready to scrape things
 - SCRAPER_STATUS_MANUALLY_STOPPED: Status when a scraper has been deliberately stopped by a person

sourceId.description: The source that this status is for.

isScraping.title: Is the source currently being re-scraped?

startedBy.title: Who started the re-scrape of all the listings?

force.title:
Ignore idempotency key to perform a search for listings immediately.
This is only intended for use during debugging by developers or one-time operations via superadmin.
It should not be used by other services as it is an expensive operation

continueForExpiredAccount.title: optional param that when true, the listing search workflow will be running for expired account

selector.title: The path to the piece of data you want to get from the page, eg. "div[class=\"bold\"]"

attribute.description:
The name of the attribute on the selector you want to get data out of. Example:
Other stuff
Passing in an attribute of "data" would get "Interesting stuff to scrape" out of the page.

toTake.title: what nodes we want to take

v1Selector.title: Selector is used to select data from an html fragment

queueId.description: queue id is no longer used since the switch to backing collections with Cadence.

ignoreCache.title: Ignore cached fragments and re-fetch the fragments from source sites

take.title: What node we want to take

seperator.title: If we are taking all how we want to separate them

v1ToTake.title: ToTake is what node returned from the selector we want to take

web_crawlerv1Type.title: Type for differentiation between review and listing scrapers
